content:
Check:
  all:
    - any:
        - name: AESCAN
          operator: equal_to
          value: Y
        - name: AESCONG
          operator: equal_to
          value: Y
        - name: AESDISAB
          operator: equal_to
          value: Y
        - name: AESDTH
          operator: equal_to
          value: Y
        - name: AESHOSP
          operator: equal_to
          value: Y
        - name: AESLIFE
          operator: equal_to
          value: Y
        - name: AESOD
          operator: equal_to
          value: Y
        - name: AESMIE
          operator: equal_to
          value: Y
    - name: AESER
      operator: not_equal_to
      value: Y
Core:
  Id: CORE-000022
  Version: '1'
  Status: Published
Description: Raise an error when AESCAN, AESCONG, AESDISAB, AESDTH, AESHOSP, AESLIFE,
  AESOD or AESMIE = 'Y' and AESER = 'N' or is empty.
Outcome:
  Message: At least one of the Seriousness criteria (AESCAN, AESCONG, AESDISAB, AESDTH,
    AESHOSP, AESLIFE, AESOD or AESMIE)  = 'Y', but AESER = 'N' or empty.
  Output Variables:
    - AETERM
    - AESTDTC
    - AESER
    - AESCAN
    - AESCONG
    - AESDISAB
    - AESDTH
    - AESHOSP
    - AESLIFE
    - AESOD
    - AESMIE
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0041
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: If categories of serious events are collected secondarily
                  to a leading question, as in the example below, the values of the
                  variables that capture reasons an event is considered serious (i.e.,
                  AESCAN, AESCONG, etc.) may be null. For example, if Serious is answered
                  "No", the values for these variables maybe null. However, if Serious
                  is answered "Yes", at least one of them will have a "Y" response.
                Document: SDTMIG v3.4
                Item: Assumption 6a
                Section: 6.2.1
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.3'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0041
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: If categories of serious events are collected secondarily
                  to a leading question, as in the example below, the values of the
                  variables that capture reasons an event is considered serious (i.e.,
                  AESCAN, AESCONG, etc.) may be null. For example, if Serious is answered
                  "No", the values for these variables maybe null. However, if Serious
                  is answered "Yes", at least one of them will have a "Y" response.
                Document: SDTMIG v3.3
                Item: Assumption 6a
                Section: 6.2.1
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.2'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0041
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: If categories of serious events are collected secondarily
                  to a leading question, as in the example below, the values of the
                  variables that capture reasons an event is considered serious (i.e.,
                  AESCAN, AESCONG, etc.) may be null. For example, if Serious is answered
                  "No", the values for these variables may be null. However, if Serious
                  is answered "Yes", at least one of them will have a "Y" response.
                Document: SDTMIG v3.2
                Item: Assumption 6a
                Section: 6.2.
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - EVENTS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - AE

json.Description: Raise an error when AESCAN, AESCONG, AESDISAB, AESDTH, AESHOSP, AESLIFE, AESOD or AESMIE = 'Y' and AESER = 'N' or is empty.

Outcome.Message: At least one of the Seriousness criteria (AESCAN, AESCONG, AESDISAB, AESDTH, AESHOSP, AESLIFE, AESOD or AESMIE)  = 'Y', but AESER = 'N' or empty.

Citations.Cited_Guidance: If categories of serious events are collected secondarily to a leading question, as in the example below, the values of the variables that capture reasons an event is considered serious (i.e., AESCAN, AESCONG, etc.) may be null. For example, if Serious is answered "No", the values for these variables maybe null. However, if Serious is answered "Yes", at least one of them will have a "Y" response.

If categories of serious events are collected secondarily to a leading question, as in the example below, the values of the variables that capture reasons an event is considered serious (i.e., AESCAN, AESCONG, etc.) may be null. For example, if Serious is answered "No", the values for these variables maybe null. However, if Serious is answered "Yes", at least one of them will have a "Y" response.

If categories of serious events are collected secondarily to a leading question, as in the example below, the values of the variables that capture reasons an event is considered serious (i.e., AESCAN, AESCONG, etc.) may be null. For example, if Serious is answered "No", the values for these variables may be null. However, if Serious is answered "Yes", at least one of them will have a "Y" response.
